metadata.title: USN-3856-1 -- GNOME Bluetooth vulnerability
metadata.description: Chris Marchesi discovered that BlueZ incorrectly handled disabling Bluetooth visibility. A remote attacker could possibly pair to devices, contrary to expectations. This update adds a workaround to GNOME Bluetooth to fix the issue.  Update Instructions:  Run `sudo pro fix USN-3856-1` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected by updating your system to the following package versions:  gnome-bluetooth - 3.28.0-2ubuntu0.1 libgnome-bluetooth13 - 3.28.0-2ubuntu0.1 libgnome-bluetooth-dev - 3.28.0-2ubuntu0.1 gir1.2-gnomebluetooth-1.0 - 3.28.0-2ubuntu0.1 No subscription required
